abstract.text: Generates a mesh in the shape of a regular 20-sided polyhedron with triangular faces.

inlineContent.text: The distance from the icosahedron’s center to any one of its vertices.
to generate normal vectors pointing toward the center of the icosahedron;
to generate normal vectors pointing outward.
An object responsible for allocating mesh vertex data. If
, Model I/O  uses an internal allocator object.

This method generates vertex data for an icosahedron centered at the origin of its local coordinate system. An icosahedron is a rough approximation of a sphere—to generate a more precise approximation, create an icosahedron and use the
method to turn it into a geodesic sphere.
parameter determines the direction of generated vertex normal vectors for the mesh. Specify
if the mesh will be viewed from inside (for example, for use in a sky effect), or
if the mesh will be viewed from outside.

abstract.text: Import, export, and manipulate 3D models using a common infrastructure that integrates MetalKit, GLKit, and SceneKit.
A container for vertex buffer data to be used in rendering a 3D object.
Creates a mesh in the shape of a rectangular box or cube.
Generates a mesh in the shape of a right circular or elliptical cylinder.
Creates a mesh in the shape of an ellipsoid or sphere.
Generates a mesh in the shape of an elliptical or circular cone.
Generates a mesh in the shape of a regular 20-sided polyhedron with triangular faces.
Generates a mesh in the shape of a rectangular plane.
Creates a new mesh by subdividing the specified mesh.
The general interface for managing allocation of data buffers to be used in loading, processing, and rendering meshes.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.

inlineContent.text: The distance from the icosahedron’s center to any one of its vertices.
to generate normal vectors pointing toward the center of the icosahedron;
to generate normal vectors pointing outward.
